definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: We were still one of the world's leading users of carbon paper and Wite-Out.
sentences.chinese: 那时，我们还是世界上主要的复写纸和修改液用户。

sentences.english: In the old days, people made copies with carbon paper . You could only make about five legible copies.
sentences.chinese: 过去，副本是用复写纸复写出来的，一般只能打五份。
这种复写纸复写质量不好。

sentences.english: Do you have any carbon paper anyone, here in your room?
sentences.chinese: 在座的各位，谁现在家里还有复写纸的？

sentences.english: The studies proved the feasibility of the preparation of microcapsule from chitosan for the use in carbonless paper.
sentences.chinese: 结果表明了用壳聚糖制备无碳复写纸用微囊的可行性。

sentences.english: I have some carbon paper somewhere or other .
sentences.chinese: 我记得我在什么地方放有复写纸。

sentences.english: The carbonless copy paper has been worldwide popular.
sentences.chinese: 无碳复写纸现已风行世界。

sentences.english: No carbon carbon paper is applied to the document.
sentences.chinese: 无碳复写纸多应用于单据上。
因此他们又发明了复写纸。

definition: red ink paste used for seal
fine paper made from bamboo, used for calligraphy, painting etc/also written 毛邊|毛边[mao2 bian1]
squared paper/graph paper/grid paper (manuscript paper with squares for Chinese characters)
